abstract.p: Rerouting and Closings On the E, B and F Lines**Work on New York City subway signals and switches will cause extensive rerouting and closing of some some subway stations along E, B, and F lines (S)

block.p: For the next four weekends, work on the signals and switches along the tracks of the E, B and F trains will cause extensive rerouting and the closing of some subway stations, transit officials said this week.

The project, which includes replacing track switches at Rockefeller Center, will force the closing of the 53rd Street subway tunnel beneath the East River. The work will take the E train completely out of service and shut down the B line for Manhattan and most of Brooklyn. It will also reroute the Queens-bound F train at 34th Street in Manhattan onto the R tracks. This means that the Lexington Avenue and Fifth Avenue stations on the F line will be closed, as will the 23rd Street-Ely Avenue station on the F line in Queens.

The project, which includes replacing track switches at Rockefeller Center, will force the closing of the 53rd Street subway tunnel beneath the East River. The work will take the E train completely out of service and shut down the B line for Manhattan and most of Brooklyn. It will also reroute the Queens-bound F train at 34th Street in Manhattan onto the R tracks. This means that the Lexington Avenue and Fifth Avenue stations on the F line will be closed, as will the 23rd Street-Ely Avenue station on the F line in Queens.

A shuttle train will run between the 57th Street N and R station and the Queensbridge station, and a shuttle bus will connect the G station at Court Square in Queens and the F and R station at Queens Plaza.
The changes will be in effect from midnight Saturdays to 5 a.m. Mondays starting tomorrow. On Memorial Day weekend, the service changes will last from midnight Saturday until 5 a.m. on Tuesday.
